intro: Eschweilera obtecta, commonly known as the black rose, is a tropical plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers, which are highly fragrant. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces woody capsules as its fruit. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
